poem:
**Brass Dawn**

A breath—  
a golden note,  
resonance in the marrow,  
trumpet's cry,  
spans beyond sheets,  
beyond the clock's ticking hum.  
Lips, chapped on brass,  
carry the weight of time.  
A melody in silence,  
a love stretched,  
across horizons,  
wakes the new day.  
In the breath,  
a life emerges,  
echoing.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Experience: I played the trumpet for 25 hours straight The first time I picked up the trumpet was 15 years ago. Before that, I had tried the drums and the clarinet. They didn’t quite stick. But when I blew my first note on the trumpet, it resonated with me in a way nothing else had. From that moment, I knew: this was my instrument. Since then, I’ve dedicated myself to music. I now teach students at". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
